text.text: How do I post a collections payment?

text: To post a collections payment, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Payments and click Payments 2. Click Create a transaction 3. Enter the payment information: In the "Payer" field, enter the collection agency name that sent you the payment.

text.text: Where can I find the option to create a transaction for posting a collections payment?

text: To post a collections payment, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Payments and click Payments 2. Click Create a transaction 3. Enter the payment information: In the "Payer" field, enter the collection agency name that sent you the payment.

text.text: What should I enter in the "Payer" field when posting a collections payment?

text: To post a collections payment, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Payments and click Payments 2. Click Create a transaction 3. Enter the payment information: In the "Payer" field, enter the collection agency name that sent you the payment.

text.text: How do I identify the patient account associated with the collections payment?

text: In the Account # field, enter the patient account number (first five-to-six digits of the claim number).

text.text: What should I consider when entering the amount collected and collections fee?

text: When you are entering amounts in the highlighted fields shown below, you are entering the amount collected for that patient's account and fee associated with that patient's payment. If the collection agency charges a percentage of the collected amount, calculate this amount and apply it to each account accordingly.

text.text: Can you explain how to calculate the "Line item amount" when posting a collections payment?

text: The "Line item amount" is calculated by subtracting the "Collections fee" from the "Amount collected".

text.text: What action should I take after fully allocating the amount for a collections payment?

text: Once the amount is fully allocated, click the Post transaction button at the bottom right corner of your payment screen. If there is only one claim on your collections payment, you are done and can STOP. If there are multiple patient accounts listed on the collection agency payment, continue to step 7.

text.text: What should I do if there are multiple patient accounts listed on the collection agency payment?

text: To post multiple patient accounts, click the Add a line item button.

text.text: How can I add a line item for each patient account when posting a collections payment?

text: To add a line item for each patient account, click the Add a line item button. In the Account # field, enter the patient account number (first five-to-six digits of the claim number). In the Amount collected field, enter the amount collected for that patient's account. In the Collections fee field, enter the fee associated with that patient's payment. The "Line item amount" is calculated by subtracting the "Collections fee" from the "Amount collected". Once you have entered the information for all of the patient accounts, click the Post transaction button at the bottom right corner of your payment screen.

text.text: What should I keep in mind when entering amounts for each patient's account?

text: When you are entering amounts in the highlighted fields shown below, you are entering the amount collected for that patient's account and fee associated with that patient's payment. If the collection agency charges a percentage of the collected amount, calculate this amount and apply it to each account accordingly.

text.text: What action should I take after entering information for each patient's account?

text: Once you have entered the information for all of the patient accounts, click the Post transaction button at the bottom right corner of your payment screen.

text.text: Can you explain the purpose of clicking "Finish later" when posting a collections payment?

text: When you click "Finish later", you can review the information you just posted. A transaction note will add a note to the transaction and all the claims associated with that transaction after the transaction is successfully posted. You cannot add a note to a posted transaction.

text.text: Where can I review the information I just posted before finalizing the transaction?

text: You can view the transactions you just posted by clicking Payments and then the date you made the deposit. There could be a lot transactions for this date so filter the page.

text.text: What should I click if I'm ready to finalize and post the collections payment transaction?

text: Once you have entered the information for all of the patient accounts, click the Post transaction button at the bottom right corner of your payment screen.

text.text: Is it possible to post a collections payment for multiple patient accounts simultaneously? If so, how?

text: Yes, you can post a collections payment for multiple patient accounts simultaneously. To do this, you need to click the Add a line item button.

text.text: how to post a collection payment?

text: To post a collections payment, you need to click Create a transaction and enter the payment information. In the Payer field, you need to enter the collection agency name that sent you the payment. When all payments have been allocated, you can click Finish later to review the information you just posted or click Post transaction.

text.text: how can i post multiple patient account?

text: To post multiple patient accounts, you need to click the Add a line item button. Once the amount is fully allocated, click the Post transaction button at the bottom right corner of your payment screen.
